More work needed to make it really nice though.

Only requires small changes in the parsers:

Read it.

1020267914031783941.text: Not only FP languages, Smalltalk too - message sends return the receiver by default, and everything in the language is supposed to be a message send. I really wish that instead of FP vs OOP we'd be debating "useful and elegant language features" vs the opposite.

1019930365488660480.text: IMHO one of the most _underpraised_ peculiarities of FP languages is that everything is an expression, everything returns a value, there's no such a thing as a statement. You have to deal with just one concept and, once you get used to it, it's a big advantage.

947177766885081088.text:
As Kay himself has said so many times, this question is entirely about funding. With ARPA/IPTO-style funding, you get Kays (and Engelbarts, Minskys, McCarthys, Corbatós, etc) With VC and NSF, you don't.

Even Kay hasn't been able to "be Kay" since the 80s: http://worrydream.com/2017-12-30-alan/ …https://twitter.com/smdiehl/status/946705788734787584 …

30492143998996480.text: @runarorama Yes, there are indeed two of them. But it is the non-associative one that gets used.

30488439954612224.text: @runarorama and the answer is, so that I can override productions with semantic actions kept separate in subclasses .

30487964492496896.text: @runarorama I wanted the sequencing combinator to be non-associative. That preserves the structure of productions.

30467298305249281.text: @runarorama But I also had specific reasons for not making them monadic.

30467138909118464.text: @runarorama Good point. I can do context-sensitive parsers, but I am not working in a purely functional setting.

29560430267473921.text: @jamesiry actors let you look a the result in the future. Got to go now.

29558236415795200.text: @jamesiry  and actors can do the same, using a similar trick: don't look at the result. That is the point.

29551545494282241.text: @jamesiry As usual, people read what they want to read, not what the post says.

29551254787063809.text: @jamesiry But bear in mind: no one will stop you from using monads if you want.  Few will want however.

29550700664987648.text: @jamesiry To take one example: I've done parser combinators and concluded I didn't want them to be monadic.

25558572674.text: Groupthink is a mechanism for making an organization more like an organism. It assimilates people to their Borg.

25558553502.text: What distinguishes an organism from an organization is that in an organism, the elements cooperate; in an organization, they compete.

25558538638.text: In any society or organization, most energy is spent competing internally among its members, not externally against its competitors.
